meanings.definition: Logical and consistent in speech or thought.
meanings.sent1: Her argument was so coherent that everyone understood her point.
meanings.sent2: The teacher's explanation was clear and coherent, making it easy for the students to follow.
meanings.sent3: The detective's coherent reasoning led to solving the mystery in no time.
meanings.sent4: His coherent plan for the project ensured its success from start to finish.
meanings.sent5: The recipe's coherent instructions made baking the cake a breeze.

meanings.sent1: The glue was so coherent that the pieces stayed firmly attached.
meanings.sent2: The tapestry was beautifully woven with coherent threads that held the design intact.
meanings.sent3: The coherent bond between the siblings was unbreakable, no matter what.
meanings.sent4: The coherent structure of the building withstood the strong winds without any damage.
meanings.sent5: The coherent layers of paint on the canvas created a stunning masterpiece.

meanings.definition: United as or forming a whole.
meanings.sent1: The team worked together in a coherent manner to achieve their common goal.
meanings.sent2: The different elements of the design came together in a coherent way, creating a beautiful whole.
meanings.sent3: The coherent family celebrated every success with joy and unity.
meanings.sent4: The diverse group of students became a coherent class, supporting each other throughout the year.
meanings.sent5: The coherent colors of the painting blended harmoniously, enhancing its overall impact.
